intro.description: This kind of analysis analyzes duplicate and similar records. It helps you define Match Rules that can be used in analyses or in match components.

item.title: Set the analysis metadata.
item.description: To open the Create New Analysis wizard, right click Analyses on the DQ Repository view and select New Analysis . Then browse to and select Match Analysis . The wizard prompts you to provide the analysis metadata (name, purpose, description...). Upon completion, an editor opens in which you can modify the analysis metadata and define the analysis settings.

item.title: Connect to a data source
item.description: Create the connection to the data source to analyze. If you already defined some metadata that you want to reuse, just skip this step. To create a metadata connection, you can click on the New Connection button in the Match Analysis editor. You can also right-click on the subfolders of the Metadata folder in the DQ Repository view. During this step, you will be invited to select the columns to analyze.

item.title: Select data to analyze
item.description: If you already selected the data to analyze in the previous step, you may skip this step. In the editor, click the "Select Data" button. Then browse and select the columns to analyze

item.title: Generate a blocking key
item.description: Select the columns that will be used to generate a blocking key. A blocking key is required when you have a lot of data to analyze. Click on the Select Blocking Key button and select the header in the data table to add columns to the blocking key section, then click on the Select Blocking Key again to finish the selection. Then choose how to generate the key (choose characters to extract, algorithms to apply on the column, etc). The concatenation of the results of the algorithms will generate a key. When complete, you can view the key profile on the data sample. This profile shows how data are partitionned. It's advised that the size of the partition is as small as possible (the horizontal coordinate).

item.title: Define the Match Rule
item.description: In the editor, click the "Select Matching Key" button. Then select the columns by clicking in the data table header. When all attribute required to match are selected, choose the algorithms to apply for the comparison ( Match Function ) and the other match parameters. When done, you can visualize the result of the configuration applied to the data sample by clicking on the Chart button. Repeat this step until the configuration is satisfying.

item.title: Export the Match Rule
item.description: Once the Match Rule correctly identifies duplicates, you can export it as a Match Rule item in the DQ Repository. The exported Match Rule will be reusable in other analyses or in Data Quality matching components.

item.title: Analyze
item.description: Click the Run icon, located towards the top left of the editor, to execute the analysis. The editor result tab will be displayed after the analysis is executed on the whole data set.
